column4: grub is installed, repaired, i see my ubuntu and winxp partition. i can go in winxp with no problem, on Ubuntu when i try to load is Plymouth main process (329) terminated with status 1. i am googling andtrying stuff for couple of hours now. anyone with similar problem today? i am now in livecd.
it seems like your menu file prlly got hosed up. i don't remember where that file is i thought it was in /boot/grub/menu*.lst
but i can't seem to find mine
https://help.ubuntu.com/community/Grub2 that is what you're looking for. There should be an area on there discussing the differences between grub 1 and grub 2
ubuntu 10.10 uses grub2. quote:"#
Grub Legacy uses boot/grub/menu.lst.
Grub 2 uses uses boot/grub/grub.cfg. " i reinstalled grub several times. i now think it could be kernel issue , but i have only latest one on grub, and dont know how to install older ones
i thought it was in a same line..
yeah if you don't care about the install just blow it away and reinstall. A fresh install shouldn't matter

there is nothing too important on my ubuntu partition, yet i would like to see what programs i have installed so that i can reinstall ones i liked, i didnt memorized them, and also i might check my download folder, but i can do that from livecd i am in now
thing is, i wanna know how to fix this stuff , it is a good for learning

if its not a fresh install meaning you had a machine that was working it broke and then you wiped the disk and reinstalled. then most likely grub broke you then reinstalled grub(fixed grub) now need to adjust the settings of the boot file to fix this.
do a paste bin of your /boot/grub/grub.cfg

it is an old install "installed day when 10.10 came out". grub2 i reinstalled several times, and i fixed any problem partition table might have, or winxp ntfs partition errors. i also removed from fstab all ntfs partitions i had there for autoload
automount*
i always go over updates list (not that i understand it really) to see if something i regulary use is getting updated, but today i didnt so i dont know if kernel was updated.
can someone with latest updates on 10.10 tell me what their version of kernel is
linux-image-generic-pae depends on linux-image-2.6.35-23-generic-pae ,however:
Package linux-image-2.6.35-23-generic-pae is not configured yet.
how to do that within live cd
didnt want that. damn xchat!!
yes xchat's fault you don't know how to use it or pastebin
